pages.text: The first act most Entheators perform in the realm of the Sunken is that of $(marked)rites$().$(br)All rites are conducted through sacred geometric patterns known as $(ml:miskatonicmysteries:world/octagrams)Octagrams$(), with the aid of reagents.$(br)Reagents can be placed in each point of the Octagram, rites are activated by interacting with the center.

However, all of that is easier said than done; rites are supernatural and as such cannot be reduced to general terms.$(br)Some rites require $(ml:miskatonicmysteries:world/occult_knowledge)special knowledge$(), provided by the original caster.$(br)Sometimes, a rite will call on one specific Great Old One. This requires a matching Octagram.
Additionally, most rites may be easily noticed, so be weary. Using $(ml:world/occult_decor)occult paraphernalia$() may help with this, though it could also make it worse.

pages.title: Triggered Rites
pages.text: Lastly, one last thing to note: rites are, in theory, very versatile.$(br)For example, some rites may be cast as a $(marked)triggered rite$(). They are not truly active until something steps on them. A rite that allows this may be cast as such by $(marked)sneaking$() while starting it, otherwise it will activate normally.
